page.title: 11SITES OF INTEREST
page.content: {WATERMILLS The{1862 O.S. map}shows{Stainton {Woollen Mill}(SD 529865),{Millbridge {Corn Mill}(SD 531873),{Halfpenny Yarn {Mill}(SD 535874),{Holmescales Bobbin {Mill}(SD 558875) and{Beckside Corn {Mill}(SD 558882). Today{Millbridge}and {Holmescales Mills}are{private houses; {Beckside Mill}is a{ruin; Halfpenny}and {Stainton Mills}have{almost vanished. { { QUAKER BURIAL GROUND, BIRKRIGG { This site (SD 538865)}lies in a {small, overgrown enclosure 350 metres {west}of{Low Park Farm.}Only{one and a {half gravestones}can be seen, though {several burials, mainly from{1682, are {recorded. John Camm}and{John Audland, two{early local Quakers,}were{buried here.{The Burial Ground}was used before the{Quaker Meeting House}at {Preston Patrick}was opened in{1689.
